docs.snippet: Kristen Stewart and Taylor Lautner will be among the presenters on the Academy Awards, but Robert Pattinson is still a no-show....
docs.lead_paragraph: Waaaay back at the beginning of Oscar season, when the Bagger was green - greener - and Adam Shankman was just a choreographer-turned-newbie Oscar producer, not one-half of the Academy's most famous odd couple, he suggested on Twitter that people like Robert Pattinson and Kristen Stewart might be a part of the show.
docs.abstract: Kristen Stewart and Taylor Lautner will be among the presenters on the Academy Awards, but Robert Pattinson is still a no-show.

docs.snippet: The Bagger's desperate plea for questions from readers was answered. Here's the first installment of feedback....
docs.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday the Bagger put forth a call for Oscar-season help and - thank God -- our dear readers responded. If we had known our desperate plea would generate such good questions, we would've groveled long ago. Here's the first installment of our answers:
docs.abstract: The Bagger's desperate plea for questions from readers was answered. Here's the first installment of feedback.

docs.snippet: The producer who put up the financing for "The Hurt Locker" sent out an e-mail message recently asking people to vote for his indie film over a certain multimillion-dollar behemoth, an Academy no-no....
docs.lead_paragraph: With just a few days to go before Oscar ballots are due, all the scuttlebutt is coming out. Last Friday, Nicolas Chartier, the producer who put up the financing for "The Hurt Locker," sent out an e-mail message asking people to vote for his indie film over a certain multimillion-dollar behemoth. "If everyone tells one or two of their friends, we will win and not a $500M film," he wrote in the e-mail message, which Pete Hammond reprinted in a Los Angeles Times blog. Though Mr. Chartier didn't mention "Avatar" by name, the reference seemed pretty clear, and a violation of the Academy's rules. Mr. Hammond thought a fitting punishment would be to revoke an Oscar seat or two.
docs.abstract: The producer who put up the financing for "The Hurt Locker" sent out an e-mail message recently asking people to vote for his indie film over a certain multimillion-dollar behemoth, an Academy no-no.
